photo.caption: Gregory Jackson and longtime partner Sophia Pope with their son Vaughn Jackson, 3, at their home in Germantown. Sophia and Gregory are happy that Vaughn is once again more active and alert, but they have concerns for his future development.
photo.title: LEADXX-HH

photo.caption: Gregory Jackson sits on the front porch with his sons - Vaughn, 3, George, 7, and Dymir, 8. After a lengthy and difficult search, the family found a safe place to live, not far from the contaminated home they fled.
photo.title: LEADXX-HH

photo.caption: Pope and her Vaughn walk home from the corner store in their Germantown neighborhood.
photo.title: LEADXX-KK

photo.caption: Pope arrives for work at Burger King, where she is a manager. Her partner, Gregory Jackson, works in an insurance company mailroom. Money is tight for the couple and finding a new rental house was a challenge.
photo.title: LEAD00004_1200

photo.caption: Pope cooks dinner while sons Vaughn and George play.
photo.title: LEAD00005_1200

photo.caption: Pope comforts Vaughn before bringing him over to her mother's house. Pope and Jackson sent their children to stay at her mother's home after they realized their former rental house was filled with toxic lead.
photo.title: LEADXX-TT

photo.caption: Jackson and Pope try to steal a quiet moment on the sofa while their children clamor to go to the corner store for treats.
photo.title: LEAD00007_1200

photo.caption: The family arrives at the home of Pope's mother, who is a big help to the family. She provided refuge for the children when they found themselves trapped in a toxic home.
photo.title: LEAD00008_1200
